items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

items.text: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.
items.plainText: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.

items.text: The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.
items.plainText: The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

items.text: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.
items.plainText: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

items.text: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.
items.plainText: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

items.text: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?
items.plainText: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

items.text: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.
items.plainText: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

items.text: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.
items.plainText: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

items.text: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.
items.plainText: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

items.text: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.
items.plainText: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.

items.text: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.
items.plainText: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

items.text: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.
items.plainText: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

items.text: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.
items.plainText: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

items.text: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
items.plainText: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
